RACE.RACE_TEXT: PENN NATIONAL RACE 1 1 1/16M Turf CR: 90. Allowance Purse 28000. (PLUS UP TO 40% PABF) FOR REGISTERED PA-BRED THREE YEAR OLDS AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NEVER WON A RACE OTHER THAN MAIDEN, CLAIMING, STARTER, OR PENNSYLVANIA BRED. Three Year Olds, 122 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. Non-winners Of A Race At A Mile Or Over Since July 2 3 Allowed 2 lbs. Such A Race Since June 23 Allowed 4 lbs. (Races Where Entered For $16,000 Or Less Not Considered In Allowances) Preference to horses with the most starts at Penn National since May 31st 2022. (If deemed inadvisable by management to run th is race over the turf course, it will be run on the main track at One Mile and One Sixteenth.) (Rail at 14 feet).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: SILK WAR was reserved two wide early, four wide on the turn and advanced to the quarter pole, came five wide into the lane and closed well to draw clear late, driving. HOLY MOLY MOSES was taken back on the inside, saved ground on the turn, cut the corner leaving the turn, tipped out and split rivals to gain the place award. CONDITION ONE was settled early on the inside, came four wide into the lane and rallied well. FED CHAIR dueled for the lead on the inside and made a bid to shake clear off the turn, but faded late. SACHMO was reserved three wide early, five wide by the quarter pole and had a belated rally. SAKETUMI was four wide into the first turn, chased the pace and made a four wide bid off the turn but flattened out. ECONOMIC POWER was three wide into the first turn, chased the pace three wide and weakened. BAVARIA dueled for the lead two wide and tired.

ENTRY.NAME: Fed Chair
ENTRY.COMMENT: dueled inside, bid 1/4, shook clear, late fade

ENTRY.NAME: Holy Moly Moses
ENTRY.COMMENT: taken back inside, cut corner, split late, got place

ENTRY.NAME: Condition One
ENTRY.COMMENT: allowed to settle inside, came 4 wide, rallied

ENTRY.NAME: Sachmo
ENTRY.COMMENT: reserved 3 wide, 5 wide turn, belatedly

ENTRY.NAME: Silk War
ENTRY.COMMENT: reserved 2 wide, 4 wide turn, came 5 wide, bid, drew clear,

ENTRY.NAME: Bavaria
ENTRY.COMMENT: dueled 2 wide, tired

ENTRY.NAME: Economic Power
ENTRY.COMMENT: 3 wide first turn, chased pace 3 wide, weakened,

ENTRY.NAME: Saketumi
ENTRY.COMMENT: 4 wide first turn, chased, bid 4 wide, flattened out,

RACE.RACE_TEXT: PENN NATIONAL RACE 2 5F Turf CR: 90. Claiming Purse 19000. (PLUS UP TO 40% PABF) FOR THREE YEAR OLDS AND UPWARD. Three Year Olds, 122 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. Non-winners Of A Race Since July 23 Allowed 2 lbs. A Race Since June 23 Allowed 4 lbs. Claiming Price $10,000, if for $9,000, allowed 2 lbs. (Races Where Ente red For $8,000 Or Less Not Considered In Allowances) Preference to horses with the most starts at Penn National since May 31st 2022. (If deemed inadvisable by management to run this race over the turf course, it will be run on the main track at Five Furlo ngs.) (Rail at 14 feet).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: NITRO TIME set the pace from the inside, turned back the bid on the turn and drew clear laving the turn, then remained well clear to prove best, sharp. STANHOPE tracked the pace and was three wide on the turn and finished willingly to be second best. GRAB THE GOLD chased the pace and was the wide on the turn, came four wide into the lane and had a mild late rally to gain the show award. FLASHINTHENIGHT chased the pace on the inside and lacked the needed bid, even effort. CASH IN A FLASH prompted the pace and made a three wide bid on the turn but weakened in the drive. KING ECLIPTICAL chased the pace in between rivals and weakened. KASIM was settled early and lacked a rally. UNSOCIABLE failed to respond.

ENTRY.NAME: Nitro Time
ENTRY.COMMENT: set pace inside, drew clear upper stretch, driving,

ENTRY.NAME: Flashinthenight
ENTRY.COMMENT: chased pace inside, needed stretch bid

ENTRY.NAME: King Ecliptical
ENTRY.OWNER: Short Straw Stable and Martin Kaci
ENTRY.COMMENT: chased pace between horses, weakened,

ENTRY.NAME: Unsociable
ENTRY.COMMENT: failed to respond,

ENTRY.NAME: Kasim
ENTRY.COMMENT: allowed to settle, lacked rally

ENTRY.NAME: Grab the Gold
ENTRY.COMMENT: chased pace, 3 wide turn, came 4 wide, mild rally,

ENTRY.NAME: Cash in a Flash
ENTRY.COMMENT: prompted pace 2-3 wide, bid 3 wide, weakened,

ENTRY.NAME: Stanhope
ENTRY.COMMENT: away alertly, tracked pace, 3 wide turn, finished willingly

RACE.RACE_TEXT: PENN NATIONAL RACE 3 1 1/16M Turf CR: 62. Maiden Claiming Purse 18100. (PLUS UP TO 40% PABF) FOR MAIDENS, THREE YEARS OLD AND UPWARD. Three Year Olds, 122 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. Claiming Price $25,000, if for $22,500, allowed 2 lbs. Preference to horses with the most starts at Penn National since May 31st 2022. (If deemed in advisable by management to run this race over the turf course, it will be run on the main track at One Mile and One Sixteenth.) (Rail at 14 feet).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: HANFORD vied for the lead on the inside, made a bid on the turn to draw clear, then drew off to prove much the best, hand ridden lane. FIFTH ELEMENT was reserved early, advanced on the turn and came three wide into the lane and rallied well for the place award. ICANDOTHAT vied for the lead three wide, then chased the winner on the inside by the quarter pole, weakened and lost the place award late. UPTOWNJACOB BROWN was settled back early, came five wide into the lane and improved late for the last spot in the superfecta. BOOK RUNNER lacked a rally. NORTHERN VIRGINIA was settled early and tired. BEJUCO tracked the early pace three wide and tired. MONEY MAKING KAZ was bumped at the start then showed little.

ENTRY.NAME: Hanford
ENTRY.COMMENT: vied for lead inside, vid turn, drew off, handily,

ENTRY.NAME: Uptownjacob Brown
ENTRY.COMMENT: settled back, came 5 wide upper stretch, improved

ENTRY.NAME: Northern Virginia
ENTRY.COMMENT: allowed to settle, tired

ENTRY.NAME: Money Making Kaz
ENTRY.COMMENT: bumped start, showed little,

ENTRY.NAME: Book Runner
ENTRY.COMMENT: allowed to settle, lacked rally

ENTRY.NAME: Fifth Element
ENTRY.COMMENT: reserved early, came 3 wide upper stretch, rallied for place

ENTRY.NAME: Bejuco
ENTRY.COMMENT: tracked pace 3 wide, tired

ENTRY.NAME: Icandothat
ENTRY.COMMENT: vied for lead 3 wide, chased inside 1/4, weakened, lost 2nd

RACE.RACE_TEXT: PENN NATIONAL RACE 4 5F Dirt CR: 67. Maiden Special Weight Purse 27100. (PLUS UP TO 40% PABF) FOR MAIDENS, FILLIES TWO YEARS OLD. Weight, 118 lbs.
RACE.FOOTNOTES: KAZ' ROSE pressed the early pace three wide and made a three wide bid on the turn to take over by the quarter pole, then drew clear leaving the turn to prove best, driving. GOLDEN EXPRESS tracked the pace on the inside, made a three wide bid nearing the quarter pole and finished willingly to be clearly second best. UNIVERSAL DESIGN was off a half a step slow, inside by the quarter pole, angled out in the lane and had a belated rally to gain the show award. MARY'S REWARD set a pressured pace on the inside and weakened in the drive. WILD CREATION was fractious in the paddock to saddle, tracked the pace two wide, lugged out on the turn and weakened. CONTEMPTUOUS MISS was settled early, wide turn and weakened. WAC IS FAST was off slowly and failed to menace. CHEERFUL TROUT was settled early and stopped.

ENTRY.NAME: Golden Express
ENTRY.COMMENT: tracked pace inside, bid 3 wide, 2nd best

ENTRY.NAME: Contemptuous Miss
ENTRY.COMMENT: allowed to settle, wide turn, weakened,

ENTRY.NAME: Wild Creation
ENTRY.COMMENT: fractious paddock, tracked 2 wide, lug out turn, weakened,

ENTRY.NAME: Universal Design
ENTRY.COMMENT: step slow, inside 1/4 pole, angled out, belatedly

ENTRY.NAME: Cheerful Trout
ENTRY.COMMENT: settled early, stopped

ENTRY.NAME: Mary's Reward
ENTRY.COMMENT: set pressured pace inside, weakened,

ENTRY.NAME: Wac Is Fast
ENTRY.COMMENT: off slowly, failed to menace,

ENTRY.NAME: Kaz' Rose
ENTRY.COMMENT: pressed pace 3 wide, bid 3 wide, drew clear, driving,

RACE.RACE_TEXT: PENN NATIONAL RACE 5 1M Dirt CR: 70. Starter Optional Claiming Purse 18000. (PLUS UP TO 40% PABF) FOR FILLIES AND MARES THREE YEARS OLD AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE STARTED FOR A CLAIMING PRICE OF $16,000 OR LESS AND WHICH HAVE NEVER WON TWO RACES OR CLAIMING PRICE $16,000 AND WHICH HAVE NEVER WON TWO RACES. Three Year Olds, 122 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. Non-winners Of A Race At A Mile Or Over Since July 23 Allowed 2 lbs. Claiming Price $16,000 (Races Where Entered For $12,500 Or Less Not Considered In Allowances).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: WILL OR WON'T pressed the early pace two wide, made a two wide bid on the turn to be clear by the quarter pole, then dug in by the furlong grounds to turn back the bid by DRY HUMOR to be clear to the wire, driving. DRY HUMOR was reserved early, made a three wide move on the turn and loomed boldly nearing the furlong marker but hung, second best. INTRO was void of early speed, saved ground on the turn, came three wide into the lane and then dropped back down to the inside and was up for the show award on the inside. BUNNY BONUS chased the early pace and came four wide into the lane, weakened and lost the show award late. LET'S GO MO lacked a solid rally. DIVINARY was settled on the inside and tired. KAZ MUSIC set a pressured pace on the inside and gave way.

ENTRY.NAME: Kaz Music
ENTRY.COMMENT: set pressured pace inside, gave way,

ENTRY.NAME: Divinary
ENTRY.COMMENT: allowed to settle inside, tired

ENTRY.NAME: Bunny Bonus
ENTRY.COMMENT: chased pace, came 4 wide, weakened, lost 3rd

ENTRY.NAME: Will Or Won't
ENTRY.COMMENT: pressed pace 2 wide, bid 2 wide, clear 1/4, turned back bid,clear

ENTRY.NAME: Dry Humor
ENTRY.COMMENT: reserved early, 3 wide move turn, hung, 2nd best

ENTRY.NAME: Let's Go Mo
ENTRY.COMMENT: reserved early, lacked rally

ENTRY.NAME: Intro
ENTRY.COMMENT: void early speed, saved ground turn, up for 3rd inside,

RACE.RACE_TEXT: PENN NATIONAL RACE 6 6F Dirt CR: 87. Claiming Purse 18100. (PLUS UP TO 40% PABF) FOR THREE YEAR OLDS AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NOT WON A RACE SINCE FEBRUARY 23 OR WHICH HAVE NEVER WON FOUR RACES. Three Year Olds, 122 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. Non-winners Of A Race Since July 23 Allowed 2 lbs. A Race Since June 23 Allowed 4 lbs. Claiming Price $16,000, if for $14,000, allowed 2 lbs. (Races Where Entered For $12,500 Or Less Not Considered In Eligibility).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: JUMPMASTER advanced on the inside and waited on the turn by the quarter pole, cut the corner and made a inside bid, then had a long drive and prevailed late to prove best. MAGIC SPIN set a pressured pace early, shook off that rival on the turn, then turned back another bid by the quarter pole, then came two wide into the lane and had a long drive with the winner and missed, gutsy effort. ZILLION tracked the early pace and made a three wide bid by the quarter pole but flattened out, held show award. SHANGHAI CANDY was settled early towards the inside, eased out on the turn and came four wide into the lane and had a belated rally to just miss the show award. CAERUS was reserved early, saved ground on the turn and had a mild late gain but needed more. MY BLUE EYES pressed the pace two wide, then tracked the pace in between rivals by the three eighths marker and weakened. SON OF A BEAST broke outwardly at the start, then was wide on the turn and was not a threat.

ENTRY.NAME: Zillion
ENTRY.COMMENT: tracked pace 3 wide, bid 3 wide, flattened out, held 3rd

ENTRY.NAME: Jumpmaster
ENTRY.COMMENT: advanced inside, waited 1/4, cut corner, bid inside, prevailed,

ENTRY.NAME: Son of a Beast
ENTRY.OWNER: J A G Racing and Jettany Thoroughbred Corp.
ENTRY.COMMENT: broke outwardly start, wide turn, no threat,

ENTRY.NAME: Caerus
ENTRY.COMMENT: reserved, saved ground turn, mild rally,

ENTRY.NAME: Magic Spin
ENTRY.COMMENT: set pressured pace, turned back bid 1/4, long drive, missed

ENTRY.NAME: Shanghai Candy
ENTRY.COMMENT: allowed to settle, eased out, came 4 wide, belatedly, missed 3rd

ENTRY.NAME: My Blue Eyes
ENTRY.COMMENT: pressed pace 2 wide, between horses turn, weakened,

RACE.RACE_TEXT: PENN NATIONAL RACE 7 6F Dirt CR: 43. Maiden Claiming Purse 13600. (PLUS UP TO 40% PABF) FOR MAIDENS, FILLIES AND MARES THREE YEARS OLD AND UPWARD. Three Year Olds, 122 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. Claiming Price $10,000.
RACE.FOOTNOTES: TRECHMO GIRL was reserved early on the inside, circled the field leaving the quarter pole and took over off the turn, drew clear to prove much the best, ridden out. CHIMING IN stalked the early pace in between rivals, made a two wide bid on the turn, gained a short lead leaving the quarter pole, then proved to be no match for the winner while saving the place award. MAKE A SPLASH was well placed early on the inside, boxed nearing the quarter pole and shuffled back, angled out nearing the furlong marker and finished willingly, bested rest. MISS MIA LIA was settled early, advanced on the inside on the turn, swung out five wide leaaving the turn and had no rally. TRAJEC HOLIDAY tracked the early pace four wide, made a three wide bid on the turn but weakened. TICK ALERT set the pace on the inside and faltered in the drive.

ENTRY.NAME: Trechmo Girl
ENTRY.COMMENT: reserved inside, circled field 4 wide, drew clear, ridden out,

ENTRY.NAME: Miss Mia Lia
ENTRY.COMMENT: allowed to settle, inside turn, swung 5 wide, no rally,

ENTRY.NAME: Make a Splash
ENTRY.COMMENT: well placed inside, boxed 1/4, angled out, willingly

ENTRY.NAME: Chiming In
ENTRY.COMMENT: stalked between horses, bid 2 wide, held 2nd

ENTRY.NAME: Tick Alert
ENTRY.COMMENT: set pace inside, faltered stretch,

ENTRY.NAME: Trajec Holiday
ENTRY.OWNER: Albright George R and Hughes Alfred A
ENTRY.COMMENT: tracked pace 4 wide, bid 3 wide 1/4, weakened,
